comments:
n20040412

I got the following NPE when starting this build for the first time. It seems
the reason it can happen is due to lack of thread safety.
AdapterManager#hasAdapter is not synchronized, but it should, since it may
trigger lazy initialization (as performed by getFactory).

!SESSION Apr 13, 2004 10:37:07.935 ---------------------------------------
------
java.version=1.4.2_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Apr 13, 2004 10:37:07.951
!MESSAGE Unable to find Action Set: org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.JavaDebugElementCre
ationActionSet
Unable to find Action Set: org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.JavaDebugElementCreationActi
onSet
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Apr 13, 2004 10:37:12.61
!MESSAGE Could not create action delegate for id: org.eclipse.debug.ui.actions.T
oggleWatchpoint
Could not create action delegate for id: org.eclipse.debug.ui.actions.ToggleWatc
hpoint
Reason:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Apr 13, 2004 10:37:12.61
!MESSAGE Internal plug-in action delegate error on creation.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException

        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.ja
va:106)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:2561)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2266)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1436)

Internal plug-in action delegate error on creation.
Fixed. The getFactory method is now synchronized
